boat.construction_details: Carvel, Pitch pine on steamed oak frames
boat.full_description:
'Random' was 'found' on Eel Pie Island, 1990, in a very sorry state.

Considerable work was carried out including 90 new frames, 14 full length planks, over 4000 copper fastenings, new deck and beams, new cabinsides, new cockpit and combings, new engine and much more.

Since her rebuild she cruised extensively and was very active with the OGA on the East Coast, converting to gaff rig in 2011.

Sadly, in 2016, she was declared a total loss following a fire at the yard where she was kept. 

She was bought by an enthusiast despite the insurance company writing her off, and she sails again from her home port in Brightlingsea.
boat.name: Random
boat.short_description: Built in 1930 by Harry Feltham, 'Random' is a one-off, originally Bermudan rigged. In 2011 she was converted to gaff rig.
